channel.title: io9
channel.description: All the top news about comics, Sci-Fi, and fantasy.

item.title: ISS Crew Temporarily Confined to Russian Module as Engineers Hunt for Pesky Air Leak
item.description:
The International Space Station has been leaking more air than usual, prompting an investigation that will confine the three-person crew to a single module for the next several days.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: George Dvorsky on Gizmodo, shared by Cheryl Eddy to io9

item.title: Captain Marvel Nearly Committed the Cardinal Sin of Bumping Off Ben Mendelsohn
item.description:
The role that the Skrulls play in Carol Danvers’ transformation into the MCU’s Captain Marvel is a complicated one that poses important moral questions about the role superheroes often play in wars across the galaxy. Ben Mendelsohn’s Talos, a Skrull commander hunting Carol in Captain Marvel goes through a twisting…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Charles Pulliam-Moore

item.title: Patty Jenkins Loves That Wonder Woman 1984's Golden Armor Was Kept Secret While Filming
item.description:
In the initial lead up to Wonder Woman 1984, there were rumors that Diana would ride into action with a new costume. Then we got our first still image and, well, she looked like Wonder Woman, albeit a little sparklier. Was that really it? Well, for Patty Jenkins, she’s glad that was what we thought.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: James Whitbrook

item.title: Google May Be Working on a TV Streaming Hub Called Kaleidoscope
item.description:
Google sure seems to be testing or developing a content hub under the name Kaleidoscope, per a dormant landing page that can be seen on Google’s developers browser.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Catie Keck on Gizmodo, shared by James Whitbrook to io9

item.title: Sony's Kraven the Hunter Movie Has Found a Director
item.description:
M. Night Shyamalan’s next mysterious movie taps a suitably mysterious cast. Bryce Dallas Howard discusses filming Jurassic World: Dominion during covid-19. Go behind the scenes of making Bill & Ted Face the Music. Plus, Henry Cavill gets dirty for The Witcher season 2, and what’s to come on Lovecraft Country. Spoilers…

Read more...
item.category: bill and ted face the music
item.dc:creator: James Whitbrook and Gordon Jackson

item.title: What's the Best Movie Trailer of All Time?
item.description:
There’s nothing quite like a great movie trailer (or a bad one for that matter). It can get you amped up for a film you’re excited to see or pique your interest in something you’d normally never give the time of day to.

item.title: The Best Breathable Face Masks, According to Our Readers
item.description:
Let’s talk about it, folks. This week’s Co-op called for breathable face masks, and with my own personal stance on the matter, I knew there’d be some friction between us. I know many are worried about their health in these times, but can we also accept that others aren’t interested in rooting in either extreme side of…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Quentyn Kennemer on Co-op, shared by Gabe Carey to io9

item.title: Sarah Elmaleh Is Fostering Collaboration Between Developers And Voice Actors
item.description:
Video game characters are much more than the sum of their pixels. Behind the dialogue, grunts and cheers is a talented actor working hard to bring life to games’ tangible but distant worlds. Sometimes their names are front and center, like David Hayter’s next to Solid Snake in Metal Gear Solid. Other times you may go…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Michael Pasquariello on Kotaku, shared by Cheryl Eddy to io9

item.title: The Miles Morales Game Might Just Have the Weirdest, Coolest Take on Spider-Sense Yet
item.description:
It’s a fundamental aspect of every Spider-Hero in Marvel Comics’ vast multiverse: imminent danger, heralded by a tingle. From hyper-sensitivity, to a flash of white, to goosebumps on the arm, Spider-Sense has been depicted in many ways across many mediums. But Miles Morales’ new video game might have the smartest one…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: James Whitbrook

item.title: Stranger Things Is Getting a Socially Distant Drive-Through Haunted House
item.description:
The scariest part is knowing you can’t leave your car. Netflix has teamed up with Fever and Secret Cinema to debut a drive-through immersive Stranger Things adventure in Los Angeles this October, where fans will experience nostalgia and frights from the Upside Down...from the safety of their vehicle.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Beth Elderkin

item.title: Mummified Kitten, Snake, and Bird Are 'Unwrapped' in New X-Ray Study
item.description:
Using high-resolution, 3D X-ray scans, a team of researchers has digitally unwrapped and analyzed three mummified animals from ancient Egypt.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: George Dvorsky on Gizmodo, shared by Cheryl Eddy to io9

item.title: Ray Fisher Says WB Is Officially Investigating Abuse Allegations on Joss Whedon's Justice League Set
item.description:
Last month—in the wake of announced plans to release a new version of Justice League recreated by original director Zack Snyder—Cyborg actor Ray Fisher took to social media to denounce Joss Whedon’s handling of the film. Among other things, he accused the director of fostering a hostile work environment. Now, Warner…

item.title: Incredible Fossil Shows a Sea Monster in the Belly of an Even Bigger Sea Monster
item.description:
As the Jedi master Qui-Gon Jinn once said, “There’s always a bigger fish.” Or in the case of the Triassic Period, there’s always a bigger aquatic reptile, as this incredible fossil demonstrates.

item.title: The Boys' New Big Bad Is Almost Too on the Nose for These Extraordinarily Racist Times
item.description:
Look to your left. Now look to your right. Did you see a Nazi? If you were reading and/or watching The Boys in anticipation of the developments coming in the second season, chances are good your answer’s a resounding “Ugh, yeah. I do.” Our deepest condolences.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Charles Pulliam-Moore

item.title: Drunk History Is Canceled Amid Comedy Central's Push Toward Reboots and Adult Animation
item.description:
Derek Waters and Jeremy Konner’s Drunk History has been canceled at Comedy Central after six seasons. It’s strange that the comedy-meets-history series was axed after it had already been renewed for season seven, but it looks to be a casualty of ViacomCBS’s new head Chris McCarthy’s drive for a top-to-bottom makeover…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Beth Elderkin

item.title: The Safe Negro Guide to Lovecraft Country: 'Sundown'
item.description:
If you clicked this link, you probably watched “Sundown,” the first episode of Misha Green’s Lovecraft Country on HBO on Sunday (if not, go watch). Now, ahead of next Sunday’s episode, you’re interested in becoming more than a casual viewer as you recognize that the series is an incredibly subversive piece of…

item.description:
